sect1.title: Posting a notification
sect1.para: Notifications are sent by using the Zym_Notification_Center. When the notification center’s post() method is called, a Zym_Notification object is automatically created and sent.
After fetching the notification center instance, you can send a notification by simply calling the post() method. This method takes three arguments, of which only the first is mandatory.
The first argument is the name of the notification you want to send. All objects that have registered to that notification will receive it.
The second argument is the sender. Usually this is the object that sends the notification.
The third argument is a data array. This can contain additional data that might be required at the receiving end.
